intro: Myosotis decumbens subsp. variabilis, commonly known as the variable forget-me-not, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern South America. It features delicate blue to purple flowers that bloom from late winter to early summer. The plant has hairy, spreading stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors or stream banks. Its flowers are typically 1–2 cm in diameter and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems.
